titleStmt.title: John Bowler and Edward McCrinkle v. James H. Bennett. Statement

bibl.title: John Bowler and Edward McCrinkle v. James H. Bennett. Statement
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington

body.p: In the District Court of the Third Judicial District of the Territory of Washington, holding terms at Seattle,
In the matter of the application of John Bowler and Edward McCrink for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

Comes to T.J. Hamilton, United States Marshal for the Territory of Washington, and in obidience to the commands of the writ of habeas corpus hereto attached and to him directed and delivered, makes answer thereto, and says:-

That as commanded by said Writ, he now has here in court the bodies of the persons named in said writ, towit: John Bowler and Edward McCrink, (the latter being called in said writ by the name of Edward McCrinkle,)

That he has imprisoned and detained, and does now imprison and detain the said John Bowler under and by virtue of a certain Final Mittimus to him, said Marshal, issued and delivered by C.D. Emery, United States Commissioner for Washington Territory, commanding him, said Marshal, to receive the said John Bowler, prisoner of the United States of America, into his custody to remain in confinement until he be discharged by due course of law; (A copy of which said final mittimus is hereto attached, marked "Exhibit A", and made a part hereof,)

That he has imprisoned and detained, and does now imprison and detain the said Edward McCrink under and by virtue of a certain Final Mittimus to him, said marshal, issued and delivered by C.D. Emery, United States Commissioner for Washington Territory, commanding him, said Marshal, to receive the said Edward McCrink, prisoner of the United States of America, into his custody, to remain in confinement until he be discharged by the course of law; (A copy of which said final mittimus is here to attached, marked "Exhibit B", and made a part hereof,)
Following is a statement of the facts proceeding the issuing of said commitments:-

On the 20th. day of June 1888, John Bowler filed with said C.D. Emery, U.S. Commissioner, an information, of which a copy is hereto attached, & marked *Exhibit C*. A hearing was had on said information before said commissioner,
at which hearing said Bowler and McCrink each testified under oath, that said James H. Bennett, on the 15th day of June 1888, at the harber of San Francisco in the state of California, did, with brass knuckles, make an assault on him said Bowler and did beat and wound him, said Bowler with said brass knuckles. At the conclusion of said hearing, said Commissioner decided and held and adjudged that the alleged assault having taken place in the harbor of San Francisco, inside the heads, was within the jurisdiction of the State of California and that he, said Commissioner, therefore had no jurisdiction to hear or determine said matter. Said commissioner thereupon dismissed said information and discharged said Bennett.
Thereupon informations were filed with said Commissioner of which copes are hereto attached and marked respectively *EXHIBIT D* and *EXHIBIT E*.

Hearings were had on said informations before said Commissioner, and from the testimony adduced, said Commissioner decided and adjudged that there was probable cause to believe that said Bowler and McCrink each had committed wilful and corrupt perjury in testifying as aforesaid and as charged in said informations. Thereupon said Commissioner held each of said persons to bail in the sum of $200. to appear at the next term of this court to answer said charges, and they each failing to give such bail, commitments were issued accordingly.
T.J. Hamilton United States Marshal for Wash. Ter
